questions.clue: This art movement, primarily in France, is known for its focus on light and brush strokes, with artists like Monet and Renoir.
Emerging in the early 20th century, this movement features works characterized by abstracted forms and artists such as Braque and Picasso.
This art style, associated with Andy Warhol, emphasizes mass production and popular culture imagery.
Originating in Italy, this 15th-century movement, including artists like Michelangelo and Leonardo, revolutionized perspective and anatomical accuracy.
A reaction against the Industrial Revolution, this 19th-century movement saw artists like William Morris advocate returning to hand-crafted art.
This Italian explorer completed four transatlantic voyages, discovering the New World in 1492.
In 1519, this Portuguese explorer set out on a voyage that first circumnavigated the Earth.
This Norse explorer is credited with being the first European to reach North America, landing in present-day Canada around the year 1000.
This Italian explorer worked for Spain and became the first European to see the Pacific Ocean in 1513.
The journey along the coast of Africa beginning in 1497 that finally led to India was commanded by this Portuguese explorer.

categories.name: The Science of Food and Cooking

questions.clue: This mineral gives table salt its salty flavor and helps in fluid balance in the body.
It's the temperature at which water boils in the Fahrenheit scale at sea level.
This natural protein is responsible for the rising of dough and providing elasticity to bread.
Maillard reaction is responsible for this process that gives browned food its distinctive flavor.
This term describes the conversion of sugar into alcohol by yeast.
For 200 points: This novel begins with 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...'
For 400 points: Identify the book that starts with 'Call me Ishmael.'
For 600 points: 'It is a truth universally acknowledged...' begins which classic novel?
For 800 points: This dystopian novel opens with 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'
For 1000 points: Name the novel that begins 'In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.'
This city has been the capital of France since 508 A.D., becoming the European center for art and culture during the Renaissance.
Before Tokyo, this city served as the imperial capital of Japan for over one thousand years until 1869.
Previously known as Byzantium and later Constantinople, this city has been key in both the Roman and Ottoman empires.
Prior to the establishment of Brasília in 1960, this Brazilian city was the country's capital for over two centuries.
This city was a major center of the Incan Empire, which named it their capital prior to Spanish conquest in the 1500s.

final.clue: This Italian city, which lends its name to a 1594 Shakespeare play now in the public domain, is a setting in both the play and the modern world.
